III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code Staff qualifications; volunteer, contractors on central registry
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206
Section (1) An agency shall require a staff member who has ongoing
Description contact with children or parents to be a person who has the ability,
experience, education, and training to perform the duties
assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 1/11/24, foster care worker put their hands over the face of two
foster youth and pushed them back. The worker told the foster
youth to get out of the area while they were trying to talk to
another foster youth. An adult sibling in the home witnessed it.
There was also an additional foster care worker present when this
occurred.
Investigation Interviews:
I interviewed Staff 1 with State Worker 1 on 1/23/2024. Staff 1
stated she was involved in a home visit and interviews with
children in the home. Staff 1 stated two other children were in the
room and an adult sister was in the doorway of the room Staff 1
was attempting to complete an interview. Staff 1 stated she asked
the other children to leave the room so Staff 1 could conduct the
interview, but the other children were reluctant to leave. Staff 1
stated she attempted to prompt the other children to leave by
putting her hands on the shoulders of the other children to guide
them out of the room. Staff 1 stated Witness 1 started to yell that
Staff 1 was pushing the other children. Staff 1 stated she only
wanted to close the door so there would be privacy for the
interview. Staff 1 denied pushing the children or that the children
were injured as a result of Staff 1's physical contact with the
children while attempting to guide them out the door. Staff 1
reported she did not have a good working relationship with the
family prior to this incident. Staff 1 stated she had already
submitted a 4 week notice of resignation from her position with
this agency prior to this incident and the agency subsequently
terminated her employment early following this incident.
I interviewed Witness 1 with State Worker 1 on 1/29/2024.
Witness 1 described the incident similar to Staff 1 except Witness
1 described Staff 1 as putting her hands on the face of the
children instead of the shoulder.
2

I interviewed Parent 1 with State Worker 1 on 1/29/2024. Parent 1
did not observe the incident, but Parent 1 reported they did not
have a good working relationship with Staff 1 prior to the incident.
Parent 1 stated she does not have an issue with the new worker
who replaced Staff 1.
I interviewed Youth A with State Worker 1 on 1/29/2024. Youth A
stated they were not hurt and didn't cry as a result of the incident
of physical contact by Staff 1.
I interviewed Youth C with State Worker 1 on 1/29/24. Youth C
stated she did not want to talk with Staff 1 and reported the
children were not injured as a result of the incident.
Youth B and Youth D were not interviewed due to their young age
and limited level of involvement in the incident.
I interviewed Staff 2 and Staff 3 by telephone on 1/31/2024.
Neither Staff 2 nor Staff 3 observed Staff 1 pushing/having
physical contact with the children at the time of the incident. They
did indicate there were no reported injuries to the children as a
result of the incident.
I interviewed Administrator 1 by telephone on 1/23/2024.
Administrator 1 stated the agency has a policy that workers are
not to have physical contact with the children. Administrator 1
stated Staff 1 was subsequently dismissed following this incident.
I requested Administrator 1 to send me the agency's policies and
procedures related to this issue.
There were no findings in the investigation completed by State
Worker 1.
Documents Reviewed
The policies/procedures were received from Administrator 1. A
review of the written policies did not indicate a specific prohibition
from any physical contact with the youth by a case manager.
Agency training – Behavior Management and Discipline Policy
Analysis The findings of this investigation indicate compliance with the
written policy of the agency. It is apparent from the interviews with
the staff members that the agency encourages staff members to
not have physical contact with children, but the written policy does
not include this specific prohibition.
3

There were no findings in the investigation completed by State
Worker 1.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
